Content: *p69437a02228*22  (c) some electric motor designs rely on electromagnetic induction.a laboratory demonstration of the principle of an induction motor is shown. analuminium disc is free to rotate and is initially stationary. a powerful magnet is moved around the disc in the direction of the arrow, without touching the disc.aluminium discmagnet(source: https://www.philipharris.co.uk/product/physics/electricity-and-electromagnetism/magnetism/eddy-current-unit/b8h79908)a student suggests that the disc will start to rotate as the magnet is moved and that the disc will rotate in the same direction as the movement of the magnet.discuss this suggestion.(6)(total for question 18 = 14 marks)total for section b = 80 marks total for paper = 90 marks
